  • Stakeholders ⁄ 
  • People

People¶

Aim¶

Identify and record all the project’s stakeholders.


Notes¶

The stakeholders are the people who (Volere)

… can affect the outcome/success of a project and, or, are affected by its outcome/success.

Examples include:

  • The client. The entity (a) the system/product is being built for, and (b) that will pay for the system/product.
  • The signatories. The people who need to sign-off aspects of the project, e.g., system security, data access, etc.
  • The end users. The people who will interact with the product.

The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF) hosts a detailed discussion of stakeholder management. The discussion includes a sample stakeholder map for an imaginary project. It is a good guide to discerning a project’s stakeholders and their import.



References
  1. Stakeholder Management, Chapter 21, The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF) Standard, Version 9.2
  2. Got stake?, by Forman, J. B. & Discenza, R., 2012
